availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Shrock (Kenton County, Kentucky, city treasurer. )

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, city treasurer. Fayette County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Shrock and Rebecca Prather Shrock. Married to Elizabeth P. Typton Shrock. Father of James Allen Shrock, William D. Shrock, and Sarah E. Shrock. Married to Mary J. Haggard Shrock. Father of Mary E. Shrock, Mary Shrock, and John Shrock. Mason in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. City treasurer in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 80B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington/Ward 2, p. 598.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, McLean County, Bloomington, p. 110B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994043, Kenton County Births, p. 99.
"John Goldsmith Shrock (1821-1875)," Find A Grave, Memorial #102350871, accessed June 24, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102350871.
